intro: Hieracium australe subsp. provinciale, commonly known as the New Zealand oxeye, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in the South Island of New Zealand. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
